DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study demonstrate pharmacodynamic bioequivalence test product reference product , use bronchoprovocation ( methacholine challenge test ) adult patient stable mild asthma .
DOC.brief_title: Pharmacodynamic Bioequivalence Metered Dose Inhalers Albuterol Sulfate Patients With Stable Mild Asthma
DOC.detailed_description: A Multicenter , Double-Blind , Double-Dummy , Placebo-Controlled , 5-Treatment , Randomized , Crossover Study Demonstrate Pharmacodynamic Bioequivalence Test Reference Metered Dose Inhalers contain Albuterol Sulfate use Bronchoprovocation Adult Patients Stable Mild Asthma
DOC.criteria: Male nonpregnant female subject ( 1865 year age ) Stable mild asthmatic base National Asthma Education Prevention Program ( NAEPP ) guideline . Forced Expiratory Volume 1 second ( FEV1 ) ≥ 80 % predict . Airway responsiveness methacholine demonstrate prealbuterol dose ( baseline ) PC20 ≤ 8 mg/ml . Nonsmokers least 1 year prior study maximum smoke history five packyears ( equivalent one pack per day five year ) . Written informed consent . Conditions could alter airway reactivity methacholine ( e.g. , pneumonia , upper respiratory tract infection , low respiratory tract , viral bronchitis and/or sinobronchitis ) within six week precede screen visit . History seasonal asthma exacerbation , case patient study outside relevant allergen season . History cystic fibrosis , bronchiectasis respiratory disease . History cardiovascular , renal , neurologic , liver endocrine dysfunction , chronic condition could put safety patient risk study affect efficacy safety analyse study . Treatment emergency room , urgent care center , hospitalization acute asthmatic symptom within past 6 month need daily oral corticosteroid within past 3 month . Known intolerance hypersensitivity component albuterol meter dose inhaler ( MDI ) .
